column1: Art Institute of Chicago////My favorite touch this visit:  They've had to temporarily move the modern galleries to an area slightly marooned at the end of the Asian galleries.  To make ammends
column2: they positioned my all-time favorite Andy Warhol
column3: a gigantic portrait of Mao Zedong
column4: on a prominent wall looking back down through the Asian galleries.  As you enter that wing and glance down the central corridor in the Asian gallery
column5: through priceless jade dragons and bronze dings
column6: this gigantic portrait of the Chairman with all of Andy's embellishments is smiling enigmatically back at you
column7: beckoning you to step on into late 20th century culture.  Clever
